intro: Oziroe argentinensis, commonly known as the Argentine firebush, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its flowers are borne in clusters and attract pollinators such as birds and insects. Oziroe argentinensis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its hardiness and visual appeal.
